form.name: unconsciousness_lethargic
form.page_subtitle: CWC Diagnostic: Child Emergencies/ Danger Signs> Unconsciousness/ Lethargic (Very sleepy, hard to awaken)

field.name: Take Action: Unconsciousness/ Lethargic (Very sleepy, hard to awaken)
Examine the airway and ensure that it is clear
Check for the presence, rate and rhythm of the pulses
Observe the respiratory rate and pattern.
Perform cardiopulmonary resuscitation [CPR] if child is NOT BREATHING
Place the patient in the Sim’s position with head supported and turned to the side to prevent aspiration in case of Vomiting
Fill out Referral Form & Refer the child to a health center or hospital IMMEDIATELY
Observe sick child and manage any additional symptoms or complications arising
Advise mother to not put the child on her back
Teach mother how to keep the child warm on the way to the health facility
Observe mother breastfeeding and counsel her on positioning and attachment if necessary
Counsel mother on feeding a sick child
Accompany mother and child to the health facility
Follow up with client after discharge from health center or hospital
